pageContext.claim: “In California, they were killing the bald eagle. If you shoot a bald eagle, they want to put you in jail for 10 years. A windmill will kill many bald eagles. It's true. … But why is it okay for these windmills to destroy the bird population? And that's what they're doing.”
pageContext.analysis: Bald eagle deaths are rare and their population is growing. It's true that golden eagles have died because of wind turbines. PolitiFact estimated 100 such deaths per year, but noted that "new designs and better siting" have reduced these incidents. The penalty for killing a bald eagle is six months in prison and a fine for the first offense and two years for a second offense.
